verses.verse: (A Plea for Justice) A Psalm of Asaph. (Ex 21.6; Isa 3.13) God has taken his place in the divine council; in the midst of the gods he holds judgment:
(Deut 1.17; Ps 58.1; Prov 18.5) “How long will you judge unjustly and show partiality to the wicked? Selah
(Deut 24.17) Give justice to the weak and the orphan; maintain the right of the lowly and the destitute.
(Job 29.12) Rescue the weak and the needy; deliver them from the hand of the wicked.”
(Ps 11.3; Mic 3.1) They have neither knowledge nor understanding; they walk around in darkness; all the foundations of the earth are shaken.
(Ps 89.26; Jn 10.34) I say, “You are gods, children of the Most High, all of you;
(Ps 49.12; Ezek 31.14) nevertheless, you shall die like mortals and fall like any prince.” (Or fall as one man, O princes)
(Ps 2.8; 12.5; Mic 7.2, 7; Rev 11.15) Rise up, O God, judge the earth, for all the nations belong to you!
